body.p: Paragraphs 31–33 of IFRS 4 deal with limited aspects of insurance contracts acquired in a business combination. That guidance was developed in phase I of the IASB’s project on insurance contracts. The IASB decided not to amend those paragraphs in phase II of the business combinations project, so as not to pre‑empt phase II of the IASB’s project on insurance contracts. In May 2007 the IASB published its initial thoughts for phase II of that project in a discussion paper Preliminary Views on Insurance Contracts.
